intro: Trigonella arcuata, commonly known as the curved cowpea, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seed pods are curved and contain several oval-shaped seeds. Trigonella arcuata is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
